early_voting_faq.question: Can I vote early (before Election Day) in person?
early_voting_faq.answer: Yes. In-person absentee voting is available for those who qualify.

early_voting_faq.question: When is the first day I can vote early in person?
When is the last day I can vote early in person?
Is there an ID requirement? If so, what is an acceptable form of ID?
early_voting_faq.answer: Yes. Voters need to provide a photo copy of an approved ID with their absentee ballot application. [Valid forms of ID](https://www.sos.alabama.gov/alabama-votes/voter/voter-id)

early_voting_faq.question: Additional information
Can I vote early (before Election Day) in person?
early_voting_faq.answer: Yes. Early voting and in-person absentee voting are available.

early_voting_faq.question: When is the first day I can vote early in person?
When is the last day I can vote early in person?
Is there an ID requirement? If so, what is an acceptable form of ID?
early_voting_faq.answer: Yes. Photo ID is requested, though some forms of nonphoto ID are also accepted. Voters who do not present valid ID are allowed to cast a ballot that automatically undergoes additional scrutiny. [Valid forms of ID](https://www.elections.alaska.gov/Core/votingatthepollsonelectionday.php)

early_voting_faq.question: Additional information
Can I vote early (before Election Day) in person?

early_voting_faq.question: Additional information
Can I vote early (before Election Day) in person?
early_voting_faq.answer: Yes. In-person absentee voting is available for those who qualify.

early_voting_faq.question: When is the first day I can vote early in person?
When is the last day I can vote early in person?
Is there an ID requirement? If so, what is an acceptable form of ID?
early_voting_faq.answer: Yes. ID is requested. Voters who do not present valid ID are allowed to cast a ballot if they sign an affidavit attesting to their identity. For some first-time voters, ID is required. [Valid forms of ID](https://portal.ct.gov/SOTS/Election-Services/FAQ/FAQ---Voter-Identification)

early_voting_faq.question: Additional information
Can I vote early (before Election Day) in person?
early_voting_faq.answer: Yes. Early voting and in-person absentee voting are available.

early_voting_faq.question: When is the first day I can vote early in person?
early_voting_faq.answer: Dates and locations will be posted at least 30 days before Election Day. [Information](https://elections.delaware.gov/)

early_voting_faq.question: When is the last day I can vote early in person?
early_voting_faq.answer: Dates and locations will be posted at least 30 days before Election Day. [Information](https://elections.delaware.gov/)

early_voting_faq.question: Is there an ID requirement? If so, what is an acceptable form of ID?
early_voting_faq.answer: Yes. ID is requested. Voters who do not present valid ID are allowed to cast a ballot if they sign an affidavit attesting to their identity. [Valid forms of ID](https://elections.delaware.gov/information/faq/voting.shtml)

early_voting_faq.question: Additional information
Can I vote early (before Election Day) in person?
early_voting_faq.answer: Yes. Early voting and in-person absentee voting are available.

early_voting_faq.question: When is the first day I can vote early in person?
early_voting_faq.answer: Monday, Oct. 24 for in-person absentee, Friday, Oct. 28 for early voting.

early_voting_faq.question: When is the last day I can vote early in person?
Is there an ID requirement? If so, what is an acceptable form of ID?
early_voting_faq.answer: No. ID is not required to vote early, except for first time mail voters. [More information](https://dcboe.org/Voters/How-to-Vote/Mail-Ballot-Instructions)

early_voting_faq.question: Additional information
Can I vote early (before Election Day) in person?
When is the first day I can vote early in person?
When is the last day I can vote early in person?
early_voting_faq.answer: Saturday, Nov. 5, but some counties might extend this until Sunday, Nov. 6.

early_voting_faq.question: Is there an ID requirement? If so, what is an acceptable form of ID?
early_voting_faq.answer: Yes. Voters need to provide an ID number when requesting a mail ballot. [Valid forms of ID](https://dos.myflorida.com/elections/for-voters/voting/vote-by-mail/)

early_voting_faq.question: Additional information
Can I vote early (before Election Day) in person?
When is the first day I can vote early in person?
When is the last day I can vote early in person?
Is there an ID requirement? If so, what is an acceptable form of ID?
early_voting_faq.answer: Yes. Voters need to provide their Georgia driver's license number or a photo copy of an approved ID with their absentee ballot application. Valid forms of ID can be found [here](https://sos.ga.gov/admin/uploads/2021_Absentee_App.9721_2.pdf)

early_voting_faq.question: Additional information

early_voting_faq.answer: Yes. In-person absentee voting is available.

early_voting_faq.question: When is the first day I can vote early in person?
When is the last day I can vote early in person?
Is there an ID requirement? If so, what is an acceptable form of ID?
early_voting_faq.answer: Yes. Voters must provide their ID number when requesting an absentee ballot. [Valid forms of ID](https://sos.iowa.gov/elections/voterinformation/voterIDfaq.html#17)

early_voting_faq.question: Additional information
Can I vote early (before Election Day) in person?
When is the first day I can vote early in person?
early_voting_faq.answer: Can start as early as Wednesday, Oct. 19, but no later than Tuesday, Nov. 1. Check with your local election office.

early_voting_faq.question: When is the last day I can vote early in person?
Is there an ID requirement? If so, what is an acceptable form of ID?
early_voting_faq.answer: Yes. Voters need to provide their Kansas driver's license number or a photo copy of an approved ID with their application for an advanced ballot by mail.  Valid forms of ID](https://www.kssos.org/forms/elections/AV1.pdf).

early_voting_faq.question: Additional information
Can I vote early (before Election Day) in person?
early_voting_faq.answer: Yes. In-person absentee voting is available for those who qualify.

early_voting_faq.question: When is the first day I can vote early in person?
When is the last day I can vote early in person?
Is there an ID requirement? If so, what is an acceptable form of ID?
early_voting_faq.answer: Yes. ID is required. Voters who do not present valid ID are allowed to cast a provisional ballot, but must provide valid ID to their county clerk's office at a later date in order for their ballot to be counted.
